page.title: 02FARMING - DERWENT VALLEY
page.content: Derwent Cote farm is situated on the south side of the River Derwent at the bottom of Medomsley Longclose Bank on the A694. The farmhouse was built in 1876 but there have been other farms there previously.The present farm is owned by the National Coal Board. It is 62 acres, slightly smaller than the average for the area, which is usually about 90 to 100acres. There are lambs,hens, geese, young beast to rear,horses,which include a mare and foal, and 4 goats, one of which is a milking goat. The young beast are brought in in the autumn and sold in the early summer. Some crops are grown, such as corn, hay, sometimes barley and potatoes. The hay is baled. The bales are small, oblong and weigh roughly 4 stones or 25 kilos. Hay is used to feed the animals, mainly horses.
